Crowdtainer.","events":{"Approval(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when `owner` enables `approved` to manage the `tokenId` If not address(0), it will be the only address allowed to create new crowdtainer projects from this manager contract."}},"createCrowdtainer((address,address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256[],uint256,uint256,address,string),string[],address)":{"params":{"_campaignData":"Data defining all rules and values of this Crowdtainer instance.","_metadataService":"Contract address used to fetch metadata about the token.","_productDescription":"An array with the description of each item."},"returns":{"_0":"crowdtainerId The contract address and id for the created Crowdtainer."}},"getApproved(uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC721-getApproved}."},"isApprovedForAll(address,address)":{"details":"See {IERC721-isApprovedForAll}."},"join(address,uint256[])":{"details":"This method is present to make wallet UX more friendly, by requiring fewer parameters (for projects with referral system disabled).Requires IERC20 permit.","params":{"_crowdtainer":"Crowdtainer project address.","_quantities":"Array with the number of units desired for each product."}},"join(address,uint256[],bool,address)":{"details":"Requires IERC20 permit.referrer is the wallet address of a previous participant.if `enableReferral` is true, and the user decides to leave after the wallet has been used to claim a discount,       then the full value can't be claimed if deciding to leave the project.A same user is not allowed to increase the order amounts (i.e., by calling join multiple times).      To 'update' an order, the user must first 'leave' then join again with the new values.","params":{"_crowdtainer":"Crowdtainer project address.","_enableReferral":"Informs whether the user would like to be eligible to collect rewards for being referred.","_quantities":"Array with the number of units desired for each product.","_referrer":"Optional referral code to be used to claim a discount."},"returns":{"_0":"The token id that represents the created voucher / ownership."}},"join(address,uint256[],bool,address,(address,address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint8,bytes32,bytes32))":{"details":"referrer is the wallet address of a previous participant.if `enableReferral` is true, and the user decides to leave after the wallet has been used to claim a discount,       then the full value can't be claimed if deciding to leave the project.A same user is not allowed to increase the order amounts (i.e., by calling join multiple times).      To 'update' an order, the user must first 'leave' then join again with the new values.","params":{"_crowdtainer":"Crowdtainer project address.","_enableReferral":"Informs whether the user would like to be eligible to collect rewards for being referred.","_quantities":"Array with the number of units desired for each product.","_referrer":"Optional referral code to be used to claim a discount.","_signedPermit":"The ERC-2612 signed permit data."},"returns":{"_0":"The token id that represents the created voucher / ownership."}},"joinWithSignature(bytes,bytes)":{"details":"Requires itself."}},"joinWithSignatureAndPermit(bytes,bytes,(address,address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint8,bytes32,bytes32))":{"details":"This convenience function is *not* EIP-3668-compliant: the frontend params._crowdtainerImplementation: the address of the reference implementation.
params._owner: Optional. If not address(0), it will be the only address allowed to create new crowdtainer projects from this manager contract.

params._campaignData: Data defining all rules and values of this Crowdtainer instance.
params._metadataService: Contract address used to fetch metadata about the token.
params._productDescription: An array with the description of each item.

returns._0: crowdtainerId The contract address and id for the created Crowdtainer.

join(address,uint256[]).details: This method is present to make wallet UX more friendly, by requiring fewer parameters (for projects with referral system disabled).Requires IERC20 permit.

params._quantities: Array with the number of units desired for each product.

join(address,uint256[],bool,address).details: Requires IERC20 permit.referrer is the wallet address of a previous participant.if `enableReferral` is true, and the user decides to leave after the wallet has been used to claim a discount,       then the full value can't be claimed if deciding to leave the project.A same user is not allowed to increase the order amounts (i.e., by calling join multiple times).      To 'update' an order, the user must first 'leave' then join again with the new values.

params._enableReferral: Informs whether the user would like to be eligible to collect rewards for being referred.
params._quantities: Array with the number of units desired for each product.
params._referrer: Optional referral code to be used to claim a discount.

returns._0: The token id that represents the created voucher / ownership.

join(address,uint256[],bool,address,(add.details: referrer is the wallet address of a previous participant.if `enableReferral` is true, and the user decides to leave after the wallet has been used to claim a discount,       then the full value can't be claimed if deciding to leave the project.A same user is not allowed to increase the order amounts (i.e., by calling join multiple times).      To 'update' an order, the user must first 'leave' then join again with the new values.

params._enableReferral: Informs whether the user would like to be eligible to collect rewards for being referred.
params._quantities: Array with the number of units desired for each product.
params._referrer: Optional referral code to be used to claim a discount.

returns._0: The token id that represents the created voucher / ownership.

joinWithSignature(bytes,bytes).details: Requires IRC20 permit.This function is called automatically by EIP-3668-compliant clients.

params.extraData: ABI encoded (address, bytes4, bytes), 3rd parameter contains encoded values for Crowdtainer._join() method.
params.result: ABI encoded (uint64, bytes) for signature time validity and the signature itself.

joinWithSignatureAndPermit(bytes,bytes,(.details: This convenience function is *not* EIP-3668-compliant: the frontend needs to be aware of it to take advantage.

params.extraData: ABI encoded (address, bytes4, bytes), 3rd parameter contains encoded values for Crowdtainer._join() method.
params.result: ABI encoded (uint64, bytes) for signature time validity and the signature itself.

leave(uint256).details: Only allowed if the respective Crowdtainer is in active funding state.

constructor.notice: Create and deploy a new Crowdtainer manager.

createCrowdtainer((address,address,uint2.notice: Create and deploy a new Crowdtainer.

join(address,uint256[],bool,address).notice: Join the specified Crowdtainer project with optional referral and discount.

join(address,uint256[],bool,address,(add.notice: Join the specified Crowdtainer project with optional referral and discount, along with an ERC-2612 Permit.

joinWithSignature(bytes,bytes).notice: Allows joining by means of CCIP-READ (EIP-3668).

joinWithSignatureAndPermit(bytes,bytes,(.notice: Set ERC20's allowance using Permit, and call joinWithSignature(..), in a single call.

leave(uint256).notice: Returns the specified voucher and withdraw all deposited funds given when joining the Crowdtainer.Calling this method signals that the participant is no longer interested in the project.

setOwner(address).notice: Set a new address to be allowed to deploy new campaigns from this manager contract.Only possible if this contract was deployed with a owner other than address(0).

documentation.text:
@notice Set a new address to be allowed to deploy new campaigns from this manager contract.
 @notice Only possible if this contract was deployed with a owner other than address(0).

documentation.text:
@dev Hook that is called before any token transfer. This includes minting
 and burning.
 @dev Tranfers are only allowed in `Delivery` or `Failed` states, but not e.g. during `Funding`.
 - When `from` and `to` are both non-zero, ``from``'s `tokenId` will be
 transferred to `to`.
 - When `from` is zero, `tokenId` will be minted for `to`.
 - When `to` is zero, ``from``'s `tokenId` will be burned.
 - `from` and `to` are never both zero.
 To learn more about hooks, head to xref:ROOT:extending-contracts.adoc#using-hooks[Using Hooks].

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct BitMaps.BitMap storage pointer,uint256) view returns (bool)
